DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether higher insulin resistance in young women with Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is associated with reduced cerebral metabolic rate of glucose (CMRglu). Brain volumes using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and quantitative cerebral glucose uptake using dynamic positron emission tomography (PET) were obtained. The potential relationships between anatomical and functional cerebral parameters and insulin resistance were assessed with the updated homeostasis model assessment (HOMA2-IR).
DOC.brief_title: Brain Metabolism in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: MRI and FDG PET scan for each participant were obtained within an average time frame of 3 weeks.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of PCOS Age ≤ 35 y BMI ≤ 35 Taking medications for diabetes or insulinsensitizing drugs Drug addictions Psychiatric illness Smoking Overt evidence of heart, liver or renal disease
